greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle generated from the array in A173302 (partition numbers starting new rows at n = 1, 3, 7, 15,...).
comment: Row sums = A000041, the partition numbers.
formula: The generating array is in A173302: (A000041 starts again in columns (1, 3, 7, 15,...)
Take finite differences from the bottom, creating a new array in which rows
are A002865(a slight variant), A027336, A027338, A027342,...; i.e. the numbers
of partitions of n that do not contain (1, 2, 4, 8,...) as a part.
example: ...Last, columns of the array become rows of triangle A173304:
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 15 2010
